byline.original: By SUSANNAH L. GRIFFEE and HOLLY EPSTEIN OJALVO

abstract: Do you feel comfortable raising your hand during a class discussion?
snippet: Do you feel comfortable raising your hand during a class discussion?
lead_paragraph: October 13, 10:40 p.m. | Updated A history professor at the County College of Morris in Randolph, N.J., asked a student with a stutter not to raise his hand during class because she felt his stuttering took up valuable class time (although the professor later disputed that account). What do you think about the professor's decision not to allow the student to participate verbally in class? What has been your experience with class participation?
